cluster_relations.rel_desc: The caterpillar forms the chrysalis, a protective shell around itself.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: The organism (caterpillar) constructs or forms a chrysalis structure around itself as part of metamorphosis.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: when it stops eating and prepares for the next stage

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Butterfly wings are formed as new tissues during metamorphosis.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: A developmental process (such as metamorphosis) produces or develops a new anatomical structure (e.g., wings, antennae).

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Antennae are among the new structures that form during metamorphosis.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: A developmental process (such as metamorphosis) produces or develops a new anatomical structure (e.g., wings, antennae).

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The chrysalis is the structure from which the adult butterfly (adult stage) emerges.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: A life-cycle structure or stage gives rise to or transitions into the subsequent life-cycle stage (e.g., chrysalis to adult butterfly stage).
remarks: Adult stage is represented via the adult butterfly stage entity.
Adult stage is represented via the adult butterfly stage entity.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Fluid is pumped into the butterfly wings to make them expand and harden.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject fluid fills the internal structure or cavity of the object, typically to enable its expansion or functional development.

args.canonical_rel_desc: An organism or biological process constructs or forms a new anatomical or protective structure (e.g., a caterpillar forming a chrysalis) as part of its development.
args.justification: The current canonical_rel_name 'forms_chrysalis' is too specific to a particular structure, whereas the pattern is a general developmental formation of a protective structure. Normalizing to 'forms_structure' provides a reusable predicate for similar organism/structure formation cases while retaining the existing, appropriate relation class and group.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: An organism or biological process constructs or forms a new anatomical or protective structure (e.g., a caterpillar forming a chrysalis) as part of its development.
executed_decisions.justification: The current canonical_rel_name 'forms_chrysalis' is too specific to a particular structure, whereas the pattern is a general developmental formation of a protective structure. Normalizing to 'forms_structure' provides a reusable predicate for similar organism/structure formation cases while retaining the existing, appropriate relation class and group.
